name: Rice
description: Rice is the staple food crop of India, thriving in areas with high rainfall and humidity. It is a major source of carbohydrates and energy.
soilType: Clayey or loamy soil with good water retention

irrigation.frequency: Continuous standing water of 2–5 cm depth
irrigation.method: Flood irrigation or alternate wetting and drying

harvesting.indicators: Grains turn golden yellow and hard

organicPractices.weeding: Use cono weeder in wetland rice

postHarvestManagement.storage: Store in gunny bags or silos

interestingFacts: India is the second-largest rice producer in the world.
Basmati rice is famous worldwide for its aroma.
Rice is grown in more than 40 million hectares in India.

name: Wheat
description: Wheat is the second most important food crop in India, mainly grown during the Rabi season in cooler, dry climates.
soilType: Well-drained loamy or clay loam soil

growthConditions.light: Bright sunlight required for grain filling

harvesting.indicators: Grains hard and golden, straw turns dry

organicPractices.weeding: Manual or mechanical in early stages

interestingFacts: India is the second-largest producer of wheat after China.
Punjab and Haryana are major wheat-producing states.
Whole wheat is rich in Vitamin B-complex.

name: Corn (Maize)
description: Maize is a versatile cereal crop used for food, fodder, and industrial purposes. It grows well in both tropical and temperate climates.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil with high fertility

harvesting.indicators: Husks turn brown and grains harden

postHarvestManagement.storage: Store in dry, aerated places to avoid fungal growth

interestingFacts: Maize is also known as the queen of cereals.
It can be used to produce ethanol fuel.
Sweet corn is a popular variety for human consumption.

name: Ragi
description: Ragi, or finger millet, is a rich source of calcium and iron. It is widely cultivated in southern India and is known for its drought tolerance and high nutritional value.
soilType: Well-drained loamy or red soil

irrigation.frequency: Once every 10-12 days in dry areas

harvesting.indicators: Earheads turn brown and grains harden

economicValue.exportPotential: High, due to increasing health awareness

organicPractices.pestControl: Neem extract spray for earhead bugs

interestingFacts: Ragi is a staple food in Karnataka.
Contains 10 times more calcium than rice.
Used in infant food and health drinks.

name: Pearl Millet (Bajra)
description: Pearl millet, commonly called Bajra, is a hardy crop grown in dry regions. It is rich in iron and fiber and forms a staple food in Rajasthan and Gujarat.
soilType: Light sandy loam to black soil

harvesting.indicators: Earheads dry and grains become hard

nutritionalValue.minerals: Rich in iron, zinc, and magnesium

organicPractices.pestControl: Neem oil spray for shoot fly

postHarvestManagement.storage: Store in jute bags or bins

interestingFacts: Bajra can survive extreme drought.
It’s one of the earliest domesticated millets.
Consumed as rotis in rural India.

name: Sorghum (Jowar)
description: Sorghum, or Jowar, is a versatile millet used as food, fodder, and biofuel. It is one of the most drought-tolerant cereals grown in semi-arid regions.
soilType: Well-drained loamy or clay loam soil

irrigation.frequency: 3 irrigations during flowering and grain filling

harvesting.method: Cutting with sickles or combine harvester

postHarvestManagement.storage: Keep in ventilated bins or silos

interestingFacts: Sorghum is the 5th most important cereal crop globally.
Used in ethanol and biofuel production.
Has high drought tolerance and adaptability.

name: Foxtail Millet (Kangni / Navane)
description: Foxtail millet is one of the oldest cultivated millets known for its high dietary fiber and protein content. It is ideal for diabetic and heart patients.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam or red soil

harvesting.indicators: Panicles turn yellow and grains harden

organicPractices.pestControl: Neem oil for shoot fly management

postHarvestManagement.drying: Sun dry for 3-4 days after threshing

interestingFacts: One of the earliest domesticated millets in Asia.
Highly recommended for diabetic diets.
Known as Navane in Kannada and Kangni in Hindi.

name: Barnyard Millet (Sanwa / Oodalu)
description: Barnyard millet is a short-duration crop that grows quickly even under low fertility soils. It is rich in iron and fiber and helps in managing blood sugar levels.
soilType: Loamy or sandy loam with good drainage

irrigation.frequency: At 15-day intervals if rainfall is inadequate

economicValue.exportPotential: High for organic and gluten-free foods

organicPractices.pestControl: Neem leaf extract or cow urine spray

postHarvestManagement.storage: Use jute bags or airtight bins

interestingFacts: Matures in just 60-80 days.
Excellent fasting food during Navratri.
Rich in iron — helps prevent anemia.

name: Little Millet (Kutki / Saame)
description: Little millet is a climate-resilient crop that grows well in poor soils. It is small-grained, rich in minerals, and ideal for gluten-free diets.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam or clay loam

irrigation.frequency: At tillering and flowering stages if dry

economicValue.exportPotential: High (used in health and baby foods)

postHarvestManagement.storage: Store in clean, dry bags or bins

interestingFacts: Called Saame in Kannada and Kutki in Hindi.
Matures even under poor rainfall conditions.
Used in South Indian dishes like dosa and upma.

name: Sugarcane
description: Sugarcane is a tall perennial grass grown for its sugar-rich stalks. It is a major source of sugar, jaggery, and ethanol.
soilType: Deep, well-drained loamy soil

harvesting.indicators: Drying of leaves, hardening of stalks

postHarvestManagement.drying: Avoid direct sun to prevent sugar loss

interestingFacts: India is the 2nd largest producer after Brazil.
Used for ethanol production in biofuel industries.

name: Cotton
description: Cotton is a soft fiber crop used mainly for textiles. It is known as the ‘white gold’ of agriculture.
soilType: Black cotton soil or loamy soil
interestingFacts: India is one of the largest cotton producers.
Bt cotton is a popular genetically modified variant.

name: Coffee
description: Coffee is a popular beverage crop grown for its beans that are roasted and ground to make coffee powder.
soilType: Rich, well-drained loamy soil with good organic matter

irrigation.frequency: At flowering and berry development stages

interestingFacts: India mainly grows Arabica and Robusta varieties.
Karnataka produces over 70% of India’s coffee.

name: Tea
description: Tea is a popular beverage crop cultivated for its tender leaves, which are processed to produce black, green, and white teas.
soilType: Well-drained acidic loamy soil rich in organic matter

irrigation.frequency: Regular moisture required, irrigate during dry spells

harvesting.method: Hand plucking of tender leaves and buds

organicPractices.pestControl: Neem and garlic-based sprays for tea mosquito bugs

interestingFacts: India is the 2nd largest tea producer globally.
Assam and Nilgiris are famous tea-growing regions.

name: Jute
description: Jute is a long, soft, and shiny fiber used for making gunny bags, ropes, and mats. It is known as the ‘Golden Fiber’.
soilType: Alluvial soil rich in organic matter

harvesting.method: Cutting plants at ground level and retting in water

interestingFacts: Known as the Golden Fiber of India.
Biodegradable and eco-friendly alternative to plastics.

name: Tobacco
description: Tobacco is a leafy plant grown for its leaves, which are dried and processed for smoking and industrial purposes.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam or red soil

harvesting.method: Leaf picking at maturity and sun-curing

interestingFacts: India is the world’s 3rd largest tobacco producer.
Tobacco exports bring significant foreign exchange.

name: Rubber
description: Rubber is a tropical plantation crop grown for its latex, which is processed into natural rubber.
soilType: Well-drained lateritic or alluvial soil

irrigation.frequency: Once in 10-15 days during dry months

harvesting.method: Tapping the bark to collect latex

interestingFacts: Kerala contributes over 90% of India’s rubber production.
Rubber trees can produce latex for 20-25 years.

name: Coconut
description: Coconut is called the 'Tree of Life'. Every part of the tree is useful, from its fruit to leaves and trunk.
soilType: Coastal sandy loam or red laterite soil

fertilizer.perPalm: 500 g N, 320 g P2O5, 1200 g K2O annually

interestingFacts: Coconut water is sterile and rich in electrolytes.
India ranks among top three coconut producers.

name: Arecanut
description: Arecanut, also known as betel nut, is an important commercial crop used in chewing and in traditional ceremonies.
soilType: Well-drained red loam or lateritic soil

fertilizer.perPalm: 100 g N, 40 g P2O5, 140 g K2O annually

economicValue.exportPotential: Moderate (used in pan and ayurvedic uses)

interestingFacts: Karnataka is the largest producer of arecanut in India.
Also known as betel nut (Adike) in South India.

name: Tomato
description: Tomato is one of the most popular vegetable crops, rich in vitamins A and C, and used in a variety of dishes worldwide.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: Tomato is botanically a fruit but used as a vegetable.
Lycopene in tomato is a powerful antioxidant.

name: Onion
description: Onion is a bulb crop valued for its pungent flavor and medicinal properties.
soilType: Fertile sandy loam
interestingFacts: India is the second-largest onion producer globally.
Onions contain antioxidants and help reduce inflammation.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic is a bulbous crop known for its strong flavor and medicinal benefits such as improving heart health and immunity.
soilType: Loamy soil rich in organic matter

harvesting.method: Pulling bulbs and curing under shade

interestingFacts: Garlic has natural antibacterial properties.
Used in Ayurveda for centuries for boosting immunity.

name: Ginger
description: Ginger is a spice crop known for its aromatic rhizomes and wide use in culinary and medicinal purposes.
soilType: Loamy or clay loam soil rich in humus
interestingFacts: Ginger aids digestion and reduces inflammation.
India is the largest producer of ginger globally.

name: Potato
description: Potato is a major food crop rich in carbohydrates, widely consumed across the world.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: Potato is the fourth most important food crop globally.
Rich in vitamin C and potassium.

name: Capsicum
description: Capsicum, also known as bell pepper or sweet pepper, is a popular vegetable grown for its colorful fruits rich in vitamins A and C.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil rich in organic matter
interestingFacts: Capsicum is rich in antioxidants and vitamin C.
Comes in various colors — green, red, yellow, and orange.

name: Green Chilli
description: Green chilli is cultivated for its pungent fruits used as spice and condiment in Indian cuisine.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: Capsaicin gives chilli its spiciness.
India is one of the largest producers of chilli in the world.

name: Carrot
description: Carrot is a nutritious root vegetable rich in beta-carotene, vitamins, and minerals.
soilType: Loose sandy loam soil
interestingFacts: Carrots improve eyesight due to high vitamin A.
Orange carrots were first cultivated in the Netherlands.

name: Beetroot
description: Beetroot is grown for its edible taproot, rich in iron, folate, and antioxidants.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam soil
interestingFacts: Beetroot helps purify blood and improves stamina.
Natural red color is used as food dye.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cauliflower is a cool-season crop grown for its edible white curd rich in vitamins and minerals.
soilType: Loamy soil rich in organic matter

harvesting.method: Cutting curds when compact and white

interestingFacts: Cauliflower is rich in vitamin C and fiber.
Purple and orange varieties are rich in antioxidants.

name: Brinjal
description: Brinjal, also known as eggplant or aubergine, is a popular vegetable crop grown for its edible fruit used in a variety of dishes.
soilType: Well-drained fertile loamy soil
interestingFacts: Brinjal is rich in fiber and low in calories.
It is one of the oldest cultivated vegetables in India.

name: Cabbage
description: Cabbage is a leafy green vegetable grown for its compact head. It is rich in vitamin C and dietary fiber.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil rich in organic matter
interestingFacts: Cabbage contains anti-cancer compounds called glucosinolates.
China and India are the largest producers of cabbage.

name: Radish
description: Radish is a fast-growing root vegetable consumed raw or cooked, known for its crisp texture and peppery flavor.
soilType: Loose sandy loam soil
interestingFacts: Radish is rich in vitamin C and detoxifies the liver.
It can be harvested in less than two months.

name: Bottle Gourd
description: Bottle gourd is a nutritious vegetable with high water content, grown widely in tropical regions.
soilType: Fertile loamy soil rich in organic matter
interestingFacts: Bottle gourd is 92% water and aids in digestion.
Used in making traditional musical instruments.

name: Bitter Gourd
description: Bitter gourd is a medicinal vegetable known for its bitter taste and blood sugar-regulating properties.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam soil
interestingFacts: Bitter gourd helps lower blood sugar levels.
Used in Ayurvedic medicine for diabetes.

name: Ash Gourd
description: Ash gourd is a long-duration vegetable crop known for its large fruits and medicinal uses in cooling and digestion.
soilType: Loamy soil rich in organic matter

harvesting.method: Picking mature fruits with white waxy coating

interestingFacts: Ash gourd has cooling and detoxifying properties.
Also known as winter melon or white pumpkin.

name: Beans
description: Beans are leguminous crops grown for their edible pods or seeds, rich in proteins and vitamins.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: Beans fix atmospheric nitrogen and enrich soil fertility.
They are rich in proteins and dietary fiber.

name: Banana
description: Banana is one of the most popular tropical fruits, cultivated for its nutritious and easily digestible fruit.
soilType: Rich loamy soil with good drainage

harvesting.method: Cutting the whole bunch when mature

interestingFacts: India is the largest producer of bananas in the world.
Banana plants are technically herbs, not trees.

name: Mango
description: Mango, the king of fruits, is widely grown in India and enjoyed for its sweetness and flavor.
soilType: Deep, well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: India is the largest producer and exporter of mangoes.
Mango is the national fruit of India.

name: Papaya
description: Papaya is a tropical fruit rich in vitamins A and C, commonly used for eating fresh and in juice form.
soilType: Fertile, well-drained loamy soil
interestingFacts: Papaya latex contains papain, used in medicine and food industry.
It is one of the fastest-growing tropical fruit trees.

name: Custard Apple
description: Custard apple is a delicious fruit known for its sweet, creamy pulp and nutritional value.
soilType: Red loamy soil with good drainage
interestingFacts: Custard apple is rich in iron and antioxidants.
It is also known as 'Sitaphal' in many Indian languages.

name: Guava
description: Guava is a hardy fruit crop rich in vitamin C, grown in tropical and subtropical regions.
soilType: Alluvial or sandy loam soil
interestingFacts: Guava contains 4 times more vitamin C than oranges.
It can be grown in a wide range of soil conditions.

name: Turmeric
description: Turmeric is a rhizome crop known for its vibrant yellow color and medicinal properties. It is used in cooking, cosmetics, and Ayurvedic medicine.
soilType: Well-drained loamy or alluvial soil rich in organic matter

harvesting.method: Lifting whole plants and collecting rhizomes

interestingFacts: India accounts for over 75% of global turmeric production.
Curcumin, the active ingredient, has strong anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Ginger
description: Ginger is an aromatic spice used for its pungent flavor and medicinal properties. It is a popular ingredient in both food and herbal medicine.
soilType: Sandy loam soil rich in organic matter
interestingFacts: Ginger is native to South Asia and is one of the earliest spices known to mankind.
It is used in tea, medicines, and beauty products.

name: Cardamom
description: Cardamom is known as the 'Queen of Spices' for its aromatic pods used in flavoring foods and beverages.
soilType: Deep, well-drained forest loamy soil rich in humus
interestingFacts: India and Guatemala are the leading producers of cardamom.
Cardamom is used in sweets, teas, and perfumes.

name: Black Pepper
description: Black pepper, known as the 'King of Spices', is a climbing vine cultivated for its dried fruit used as spice and seasoning.
soilType: Well-drained clay loam soil rich in organic matter
interestingFacts: Black pepper is native to the Western Ghats of India.
It was once used as a form of currency.

name: Clove
description: Clove is a valuable aromatic spice used in food, perfumery, and medicine for its antiseptic properties.
soilType: Deep loamy soil with good drainage
interestingFacts: Cloves are flower buds dried before opening.
Indonesia and India are leading producers.

name: Tomato
description: Tomato is a widely cultivated vegetable used in various cuisines. It is rich in vitamin C, lycopene, and antioxidants.
soilType: Well-drained loamy soil

harvesting.method: Manual picking of red ripe fruits

interestingFacts: Tomatoes were once considered poisonous in Europe.
Rich in lycopene, an antioxidant beneficial for heart health.

name: Onion
description: Onion is an essential spice and vegetable crop used in almost every cuisine.
soilType: Fertile sandy loam

growthConditions.climate: Cool and dry during bulb formation

interestingFacts: India is the second-largest producer of onions.
Onion has antibacterial and heart-healthy properties.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic is a spice crop valued for its flavor and medicinal properties.
soilType: Well-drained sandy loam
interestingFacts: Garlic is known for lowering blood pressure.
Used both as a spice and herbal medicine.
